item.title: Team & Goal of the week: Superliga 2019/20 Round Twenty
item.dc:creator: pedrocoates
item.description: River Plate maintained their lead at the top of the table with a win over Banfield but will be pushed by Boca Juniors after Carlos Tevez inspired the Xeneizes to […]
item.content:encoded:
River Plate maintained their lead at the top of the table with a win over Banfield but will be pushed by Boca Juniors after Carlos Tevez inspired the Xeneizes to a 4-0 win away to Central C√≥rdoba.

Argentinos Juniors returning to winning ways in Tucum√°n and Lan√∫s drawing with Newell’s leaves the race for Copa Libertadores qualification wide open.

And matters in the relegation battle also got more complicated with Gimnasia suffering a damaging defeat to Rosario Central while Patronato and Aldosivi picked up wins. Col√≥n’s draw with Racing saw the Sabalero drop into the bottom three.

A shorted than usual Team of the week, here are the eleven that made the eleven according to SofaScore.

To catch up with previous Teams of the week‚Ä¶.

Week 1 ‚Äì Week 2 ‚Äì Week 3 ‚Äì Week 4 ‚Äì Week 5 ‚Äì Week 6 ‚Äì Week 7 ‚Äì Week 8 ‚Äì Week 9 ‚Äì Week 10 ‚Äì Week 11 ‚Äì Week 12 ‚Äì Week 13 ‚Äì Week 14 ‚Äì Week 15 ‚Äì Week 16 ‚Äì Week 17 ‚Äì Week 18 – Week 19

Mauricio Arboleda || Banfield

Gonzalo Montiel || River Plate

Leandro Mar√≠n || Patronato

Lautaro Valenti || Lan√∫s

Bruno Urrubarri || Patronato

Eduardo Salvio || Boca Juniors

Andr√©s Cubas || Talleres

Federico Gino || Aldosivi

Francisco Pizzini || Defensa y Justicia

Player of the week
Carlos Tevez || Boca Juniors

Lautaro Acosta || Lan√∫s

Goal of the week

Mat√≠as Zaracho – Col√≥n v RACING

Jonathan Men√©ndez – TALLERES v San Lorenzo

Leandro Fern√°ndez – INDEPENDIENTE v Arsenal

item.title: Independiente snatch last gasp draw with Arsenal & Defensa y Justicia stun Estudiantes (VIDEO)
item.dc:creator: pedrocoates
item.description: As Arsenal’s players and staff raged at full-time there was hardly a positive atmosphere coming from Independiente either as Leandro Fern√°ndez’s stoppage time equaliser did little to lift the tension […]
item.content:encoded:
As Arsenal’s players and staff raged at full-time there was hardly a positive atmosphere coming from Independiente either as Leandro Fern√°ndez’s stoppage time equaliser did little to lift the tension at the Estadio Libertadores de Am√©rica.

Independiente supporters were pushed to the limit by last week’s cl√°sico defeat and with Alan Franco potentially the latest to head out the door the lack of any incomings has left the squad to be propped up by academy players.

The latest to take advantage were an Arsenal side making a surprise challenge for CONMEBOL cup competition qualification and Sergio Rondina’s side were about 30 seconds away from securing an important win.

A well worked set-piece that resulted in Gast√≥n √Ålvarez Su√°rez smashing Arsenal in front after quarter of an hour looked to be enough.

The home team had toiled all evening in the rain to create clear chances and referee Nazareno Arasa awarding a soft free-kick deep in injury time was a final roll of the dice for Independiente. Substitute Leandro Fern√°ndez stepped up and bent a wonderful strike past Daniel Sappa only for his celebrations to earn him a second yellow card.

That didn’t matter but Arsenal were furious at the officials and when the full-time whistle blew seconds later, Sergio Rondina led the charge toward Arasa.

Independiente 1 – 1 Arsenal

Earlier in La Plata, Defensa y Justicia pulled off a surprise win over Estudiantes to give manager Hern√°n Crespo his first win since taking charge of the Halc√≥n.

A bright start from the home team saw Marcos Rojo go close before Gast√≥n Fern√°ndez’s ill-judged panenka saw a 19th-minute penalty wasted.

That was almost immediately punished, Francisco Pizzini slipping his first goal for Defensa y Justicia through the legs of Mariano And√∫jar.

The goal boosted the visitors’ confidence and just after the hour mark Rub√©n Botta curled in a second as Crespo’s side looked to end any hope of an Estudiantes comeback.

Mateo Retegui managed to pull one back late on but it was only a consolation for Estudiantes, who suffered their first defeat in six matches.

Estudiantes 1 – 2 Defensa y Justicia

item.title: River Plate remain three points clear of Boca Juniors at the top after both win & Newell‚Äôs take a point in Lan√∫s (VIDEO)
item.dc:creator: pedrocoates
item.description: Only two remain in the title race regardless of what is mathematically possible and while River Plate continue on their path towards a first league title under Marcelo Gallardo, old […]
item.content:encoded:
Only two remain in the title race regardless of what is mathematically possible and while River Plate continue on their path towards a first league title under Marcelo Gallardo, old rivals Boca Juniors will ensure that the Millonarios are pushed all the way.

Banfield were the visitors to the Monumental on Sunday evening and despite a storm hitting during the second half, River held on for a deserved fifth consecutive win.

Mat√≠as Su√°rez headed River in front early after some fine work by Gonzalo Montiel down the right and it should have been far more comfortable when former River defender Luciano Lollo was penalised for handball. Superliga leading scorer Rafael Santos Borr√© stepped up but the crossbar denied the Colombian his twelfth goal of the season and River’s lead remained at one.

Banfield posed almost no threat but may feel that River were a little fortunate only to have Lucas Mart√≠nez Quarta and Mat√≠as Su√°rez booked for late challenges that on another day could have been more harshly dealt with by referee Fernando Rapallini.

River’s domination continued after the break with Santos Borr√© again hitting the woodwork and even when the home side did hit the target they found Banfield goalkeeper Mauricio Arboleda in fine form.

There was a late scare in the driving rain as Daniel Osvaldo came off the bench for his Banfield debut and had Franco Armani scrambling with an audacious lob attempt.

River secured the win and are now three games from the title. Seven points would do it and with that in sight it would be a huge upset if the Superliga was to slip through their fingers.

River Plate 0 – 1 Banfield

Boca Juniors will not make it easy for River and a 4-0 win over Central C√≥rdoba in Santiago del Estero swiftly reduced the gap back to three points.

A potentially tricky trip to the sweltering north, it took only four minutes for Boca to lead, Carlos Tevez pouncing on an underhit backpass by former Boca midfielder Marcelo Meli to round Diego Rodr√≠guez and roll in the opener.

Central C√≥rdoba lacked the cutting edge to find a way back and midway through the first half were punished on the counter with Eduardo Salvio eventually firing Boca two in front.

Tevez saw a penalty saved before the break but didn’t take long after the break to add Boca’s third and minutes later despite clearly being offside Sebasti√°n Villa tapped in a fourth.

Another penalty presented Boca with the chance to chalk up a fifth. Tevez opted not to go his hat-trick following his prior miss only for Franco Soldano to suffer the same fate, Diego Rodr√≠guez guessing correctly and making a fine stop.

It didn’t matter and although Boca’s return to form may have come a little too late, Miguel √Ångel Russo’s side will ensure that the title race goes to the wire. One defeat for River and a three more wins for Boca would set up an explosive title decider.

Central C√≥rdoba 0 – 4 Boca Juniors

Elsewhere, Lan√∫s climbed to fourth after a 1-1 draw with Newell’s Old Boys in La Fortaleza.

After a first half of few clear chances, Newell’s led just before the hour mark, Sebasti√°n Palacios slotting in after Pablo P√©rez’s initial shot had been saved.

The lead though lasted only a few minutes. Cristian Lema scythed down Lautaro Acosta and Jos√© Sand made no mistake from the penalty spot.

Lan√∫s remain on course for Copa Libertadores qualification and while Newell’s have flirted with the relegation battle, La Lepra are well placed for at least a Copa Sudamericana spot.

Lan√∫s 1 – 1 Newell’s Old Boys

item.title: Gimnasia remain bottom in defeat while Aldosivi climb out of bottom three, Argentinos Juniors up to third & Talleres see off San Lorenzo in chaotic encounter (VIDEO)
item.dc:creator: pedrocoates
item.description: Newell’s Old Boys icon Diego Maradona wasn’t given the red carpet treatment for the first time on his travels this season and the Gimnasia manager’s evening was made even worse […]
item.content:encoded:
Newell’s Old Boys icon Diego Maradona wasn’t given the red carpet treatment for the first time on his travels this season and the Gimnasia manager’s evening was made even worse by defeat to Rosario Central in the Gigante de Arroyito.

Aldosivi winning and Col√≥n picking up a point already added a little extra pressure on Gimnasia for points but El Lobo made the worst possible start.

A long throw-in after ten minutes wasn’t cleared and as the ball bobbled into space, Sebasti√°n Ribas spun to thrash the ball past Jorge Broun.

Both sides lacked ideas and Ribas’ early goal ultimately proved decisive. Despite Gimnasia’s predicament at the foot of the relegation table, Maradona said that he was keen to remain in La Plata and although admitted his side weren’t good enough, added, ‘if we deserve to go the B, so too do Central.’

Rosario Central 1 – 0 Gimnasia

It was far better news for Aldosivi after a victory over struggling Hurac√°n lifted them out of the drop zone at the expense of Col√≥n.

It took a bit of luck and an outstanding performance by veteran goalkeeper Luciano Pocrnjic to keep a clean sheet in Parque Patricios and that provided the foundation for a hugely significant 2-0 win.

Early substitute Pablo Becker opened the scoring after 23 minutes with a bouncing shot from outside the box.

The goal coming after Pocrnjic had already pulled off his first flying save to stop Juan Vieyra’s pin-point free-kick. It proved the first of a few excellent saves and even after Aldosivi were reduced to ten men with Leandro Maciel being shown his second yellow card, Hurac√°n couldn’t take advantage.

In fact it was the ten men of Aldosivi that extended their lead, Federico Gino’s deflected effort sneaking past Antony Silva.

Even when Pocrnjic was beaten, Mart√≠n Ojeda’s long range volley clattered off the crossbar as Hurac√°n slumped to another defeat.

Hurac√°n 0 – 2 Aldosivi

Argentinos Juniors picked up their first win in six games to climb back up to third and keep their 2021 Copa Libertadores qualification hopes intact.

Atl√©tico Tucum√°n were the hosts, only a few days after El Decano had progressed to the third round of this year’s Libertadores, and it was the home side that had the better of the first half chances.

Goals have proved a problem for Argentinos Juniors and they were once more struggling to break down Atl√©tico until twenty minutes from time when Leandro D√≠az was sent off for what was adjudged an elbow on Miguel Torr√©n.

The home side shot themselves in the foot once again soon after, Gustavo Toledo’s rash challenge on El√≠as G√≥mez presenting Santiago Silva with the chance to break the deadlock from the penalty spot.

Gabriel Hauche wrapped up the win late on and there was still time for Guillermo Acosta to reduce Atl√©tico to nine when his frustration boiled over.

Atl√©tico Tucum√°n 0 – 2 Argentinos Juniors

With three games to play Argentinos Juniors know that Libertadores qualification is close and Talleres are still aiming for a Copa Sudamericana spot after victory over direct rival San Lorenzo in C√≥rdoba.

A dull opening period only came to life when Juan Ram√≠rez was wrongly sent off moments before the break. According to reports, manager Diego Monarriz had decided to replace Oscar Romero at half time as part of the reshuffle and when twin brother √Ångel voiced his disagreement it prompted Monarriz to withdraw the pair.

If that wasn’t bad enough for San Lorenzo it took Talleres less than five minutes of the second half to take the lead, Jonathan Men√©ndez drilling a fierce low shot from distance past Sebasti√°n Torrico.

Talleres goalkeeper Guido Herrera made a superb double-stop to deny San Lorenzo but his sending off for a wild challenge on Adolfo Gaich sparked a chaotic end to the game. Leading scorer Nahuel Bustos was forced to go in goal for the closing stages and Men√©ndez then followed Herrera for an early bath after seeing his second yellow card.

Despite being down to nine and with their star striker in goal, Talleres held on for all three points. La T, in the pack of clubs vying for a top ten finish, are now two points behind San Lorenzo currently occupying that final Sudamericana spot.

Talleres 1 – 0 San Lorenzo

item.title: Patronato snatch late win over Uni√≥n & Col√≥n hold Racing (VIDEO)
item.dc:creator: pedrocoates
item.description: There is still a way to go in this season’s Superliga relegation battle but Patronato breathed some hope into their survival bid with a late win over ten-man Uni√≥n on […]
item.content:encoded:
There is still a way to go in this season’s Superliga relegation battle but Patronato breathed some hope into their survival bid with a late win over ten-man Uni√≥n on Friday evening.

It had looked as though Patronato would allow a great opportunity for a vital three points to slip away after a string of missed chances and two shots against the woodwork against a Uni√≥n side playing with ten after Walter Bou’s first half sending off.

The Uni√≥n striker’s high boot planting firmly into the chest of goalkeeper Mat√≠as Ib√°√±ez earned Bou his marching orders but Cristian Tarragona, Lautaro Comas and Gabriel √Åvalos all wasting chances, victory was slipping away until substitute Hugo Silveira scored two minutes from time.

Patronato remain in the relegation zone but closed to within four points of safety after Col√≥n could only pick up a point from the visit of Racing Club.

Col√≥n’s form has made the Sabalero the most likely candidate to save one of the clubs currently occupying the bottom three yet there were fresh signs of life in Diego Osella’s side.

Racing were coming in with the momentum of a historic cl√°sico win in their sails but were unable to follow it up with what would have been only a second win under Sebasti√°n Beccacece.

A wonderful Mat√≠as Zaracho goal put Racing ahead just after the hour mark, the Argentina under-23 international back from sealing a place at the Olympics finishing emphatically following a fine burst forward by Mat√≠as Rojas.

Col√≥n though didn’t give up and Wilson Morelo headed an equaliser from an 80th minute corner. Luis Rodr√≠guez, who had missed one good chance during the first half then sent a header inches wide before Dari√≥ Cvitanich did the same at the other end.

The point leaves Col√≥n still in huge danger and saw Racing miss the chance to climb into the top four.

Patronato 1 – 0 Uni√≥n

Col√≥n 1 – 1 Racing Club

item.title: Copa Sudamericana: Leandro Fern√°ndez gives Independiente narrow first leg lead over Fortaleza (VIDEO)
item.dc:creator: pedrocoates
item.description: Independiente were in need of a response after the weekend’s embarrassing cl√°sico defeat to Racing Club and while it was hardly a performance to silence the critics it was a […]
item.content:encoded:
Independiente were in need of a response after the weekend’s embarrassing cl√°sico defeat to Racing Club and while it was hardly a performance to silence the critics it was a much needed victory over Fortaleza.

El Rojo will head to the north of Brazil in a couple of weeks to finish the job and secure a place in the Copa Sudamericana second round but have plenty still to do with only a one-goal advantage.

How it only ended 1-0 in Avellaneda is only down to some very poor finishing from both teams and Fortaleza will certainly regret not finding at least one away goal.

The Brazilians, managed by former goalscoring goalkeeper Rog√©rio Ceni, were the far brighter in the opening exchanges and Osvaldo and David both had glorious chances to break the deadlock.

Just as they were against Racing’s nine men on Sunday, Independiente struggled to find any cohesion to their attacks and aside from Mart√≠n Ben√≠tez going close with a diving header when the forward should have at least tested the goalkeeper, El Rojo struggled to create much.

As the first half drew to a close both sides were reduced to ten men when Fortaleza defender Juan Quintero slapped Juan S√°nchez Mi√±o during a penalty box melee. The Colombian being shown a straight red and S√°nchez Mi√±o a second yellow for his part.

Shortly after the break Independiente finally clicked for a moment as Fabricio Bustos overlapped down the right, his cutback found Leandro Fern√°ndez and the forward fired a low shot inside Felipe Alves’ near post.

The chances didn’t stop there though and Romarinho was guilty of the worst miss. Fortaleza desperately wanted that away goal to take back to the Est√°dio Castel√£o in two weeks and from only three yards out Romarinho failed to find the target.

The visitors weren’t alone in their ineptitude to hit the net and substitute Braian Mart√≠nez looked set to score his first senior goal when left unmarked to nod in from close range but somehow the 20-year-old missed the target.

Lucas Pusineri will know that huge improvements are required but at least in victory the Independiente coach avoided throwing any further gasoline on the fire.

¬°Para volver a ver! Lo mejor del triunfo de @Independiente ante @FortalezaEC en la ida de la Primera Fase de la #Sudamericana. pic.twitter.com/Uphu7wWHgL

‚Äî CONMEBOL Sudamericana (@Sudamericana) February 14, 2020

item.title: Atl√©tico Tucum√°n progress after shootout drama in Copa Libertadores while Lan√∫s secure big first leg advantage in Copa Sudamericana (VIDEO)
item.dc:creator: pedrocoates
item.description: Atl√©tico Tucum√°n certainly don’t look like a side capable of matching 2018’s run to the Copa Libertadores quarter-finals but El Decano booked a spot in Round Three after overcoming a […]
item.content:encoded:
Atl√©tico Tucum√°n certainly don’t look like a side capable of matching 2018’s run to the Copa Libertadores quarter-finals but El Decano booked a spot in Round Three after overcoming a 2-0 first leg defeat to The Strongest to emerge victorious on penalties.

Well beaten in the altitude of La Paz last week, Ricardo Zielinski knew what his side were up against in a typically vibrant Estadio Jos√© Fierro and despite some nervy moments Atl√©tico prevailed.

Marcelo Ort√≠z heading in at a corner after 22 minutes cut the deficit but Atl√©tico’s attack was all too predictable as they launched the ball in the direction of Leandro Diaz and Javier Toledo.

The few changes that came their way The Strongest were unable to take advantage and without the away goal that would surely have killed off Atl√©tico’s hopes.

Instead another cross into the box by Lucas Melano was headed in by Leonardo Heredia and the 2-0 scoreline ensured penalties.

Javier Toledo missing the first for the home team handed the advantage to the Bolivians and substitute Rolando Blackburn had the chance to win the tie but instead stuttered and hopped like former Decano hero Pulga Rodr√≠guez and saw his effort saved by Cristian Lucchetti.

Earlier goalscorer Ort√≠z slotted in for Atl√©tico and Lucchetti’s second stop to deny Sa√∫l Torres clinched victory.

Independiente de Medell√≠n await in Round Three with a place in Group H up for grabs.

¬°Noche de emociones en Tucum√°n!‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
Para volver a ver: el triunfo por penales de @ATOficial, tras haber ganado 2⃣-0⃣, ante @ClubStrongest.‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
El equipo argentino est√° en la Fase 3 de la #Libertadores.‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£@FutbolSantander pic.twitter.com/UgCiU7zv1a

‚Äî CONMEBOL Libertadores (@Libertadores) February 13, 2020

Earlier in the first round of the Copa Sudamericana, Lan√∫s surely placed one foot in the next stage after a 3-0 first leg win over Universidad Cat√≥lica.

Utterly dominant and having hit the woodwork twice during the opening 45 minutes it took until the 53rd minute for Lautaro Acosta to slide in the opener.

Only a one-goal advantage would have still been nervy ahead of a second leg in Quito but Nicol√°s Orsini came off the bench and struck a quick-fire double from close range.

¬°Lo mejor de la goleada 3-0 de @clublanus ante @UCatolicaEC por la ida de la Primera Fase de la #Sudamericana! pic.twitter.com/ULEGiLjcct

‚Äî CONMEBOL Sudamericana (@Sudamericana) February 13, 2020

item.title: Argentinos Juniors with work to do after first leg Copa Sudamericana draw (VIDEO)
item.dc:creator: pedrocoates
item.description: An underwhelming start to 2020 has already seen Argentinos Juniors’ Superliga dreams fade and a first leg draw with Peruvian club Sport Huancayo leaves plenty to do in two weeks […]
item.content:encoded:
An underwhelming start to 2020 has already seen Argentinos Juniors’ Superliga dreams fade and a first leg draw with Peruvian club Sport Huancayo leaves plenty to do in two weeks to ensure the Copa Sudamericana doesn’t go the same way.

Diego Dabove’s side dominated for long periods but as has been the problem domestically, Argentinos Juniors failed to find that final pass or the finishing touch in front of goal.

Edwar L√≥pez was handed an opportunity up front on Tuesday evening and should have given the home side the lead early on despite forcing Joel Pinto into a good stop.

And with Argentinos Juniors pressing for that breakthrough it was the visitors that snatched the lead before the break. Nicking possession in their own half Sport Huancayo broke at pace with a numerical advantage and eventually Marcos Lliuya’s deflected shot flew into the net.

An away goal in La Paternal certainly makes things more complicated for Argentinos Juniors in the altitude of Huancayo in two weeks and defeat would have been even worse.

The reaction to Gabriel Hauche forcing an equaliser from close range twenty minutes from time made that clear. The 33-year-old snatched the ball from the net and ran back to the centre as Argentinos looked for a winner. A second goal that never came.

The two sides meet on February 25th and Sport Huancayo will sense they may not have a better chance of progression.

¬°Para volver a ver! Reviv√≠ lo mejor del empate 1-1 entre @AAAJoficial y @clubshuancayo en el partido de ida de la Primera Fase de la #Sudamericana. pic.twitter.com/3p93gBk6bO

‚Äî CONMEBOL Sudamericana (@Sudamericana) February 12, 2020

item.title: Team & Goal of the week: Superliga 2019/20 Round Nineteen
item.dc:creator: pedrocoates
item.description: It was a little nervy but River Plate came from behind to beat Uni√≥n and with it continue on their path to a first league title under Marcelo Gallardo. Boca […]
item.content:encoded:
It was a little nervy but River Plate came from behind to beat Uni√≥n and with it continue on their path to a first league title under Marcelo Gallardo.

Boca Juniors now appear to be River’s only genuine rivals after the Xeneizes defeated Atl√©tico Tucum√°n in La Bombonera.

That after Argentinos Juniors and Lan√∫s shared the points and the likes of Newell’s, V√©lez and Arsenal all dropping points in a heavily congested Superliga table beneath the top two.

Racing Club were the weekend’s big winners after a historic cl√°sico win over Independiente. La Academia battled with nine men for the entire second half to snatch it late on and Sebasti√°n Beccacece will now be looking to finish the season well to book a 2021 Copa Libertadores spot.

In the relegation battle, Gimnasia’s failure to beat Patronato kept both sides in the drop zone and with Aldosivi losing to Central C√≥rdoba, the current bottom three are in real danger. Only perhaps the form of Col√≥n, who drew away to Defensa y Justicia can help on of those three.

A shorted than usual Team of the week, here are the eleven that made the eleven according to SofaScore.

To catch up with previous Teams of the week‚Ä¶.

Week 1 ‚Äì Week 2 ‚Äì Week 3 ‚Äì Week 4 ‚Äì Week 5 ‚Äì Week 6 ‚Äì Week 7 ‚Äì Week 8 ‚Äì Week 9 ‚Äì Week 10 ‚Äì Week 11 ‚Äì Week 12 ‚Äì Week 13 ‚Äì Week 14 ‚Äì Week 15 ‚Äì Week 16 ‚Äì Week 17 – Week 18

Player of the week
Agust√≠n Rossi || Lan√∫s

Juan Rodr√≠guez || Defensa y Justicia

Paolo Goltz || Gimnasia

Ezequiel Mu√±oz || Lan√∫s

Mariano Bittolo || Newell’s Old Boys

Lucas Piovi || Arsenal

Jorman Campuzano || Boca Juniors

Gast√≥n Gim√©nez || V√©lez Sarsfield

Miguel Merentiel || Godoy Cruz

Francis Mac Allister || Argentinos Juniors

Santiago Garc√≠a || Godoy Cruz

Goal of the week

Juan Vieyra – Godoy Cruz v HURAC√ÅN

item.title: Godoy Cruz heap pressure on Hurac√°n & nine-man Talleres hold Arsenal (VIDEO)
item.dc:creator: pedrocoates
item.description: Bottom of the table Godoy Cruz had lost fifteen of their eighteen games before Monday evening and yet still proved too much for a Hurac√°n side in a dangerous nosedive. […]
item.content:encoded:
Bottom of the table Godoy Cruz had lost fifteen of their eighteen games before Monday evening and yet still proved too much for a Hurac√°n side in a dangerous nosedive.

Without a win since October’s cl√°sico against San Lorenzo, Hurac√°n and Godoy Cruz are already being dragged into next season’s relegation battle.

Despite the dreadful form of both sides there were chances at either end before a smart finish from captain Santiago Garc√≠a broke the deadlock just before the break. And it got worse for Hurac√°n just after the break, Miguel Merentiel poking the ball past Antony Silva to double the lead.

A late rally saw Mart√≠n Ojeda hit the crossbar from a free-kick and Juan Vieyra pull a goal back in stoppage time with a tremendous acrobatic volley but it was too late.

Godoy Cruz remain bottom of the Superliga but it should be Hurac√°n truly concerned about their current plight.

Godoy Cruz 2 – 1 Hurac√°n

Earlier in Sarand√≠, Talleres held Arsenal to a draw despite being reduced to nine men.

Guilherme Parede had given Talleres the lead before the half hour mark, the Brazilian following up Franco Fragapane’s saved penalty, but the visitors saw Diego Valoyes sent off before the break.

A man down and inviting pressure it took only five minutes of the second half for Juan Manuel Garc√≠a to slide in an equaliser and once Leonardo Godoy was shown a second yellow card to further hinder Talleres, Arsenal sensed an opportunity.

Seven minutes from time the home side had their best chance but Nicol√°s Gim√©nez’s penalty was well saved by Guido Herrera and it earned Talleres a point.

Arsenal 1 – 1 Talleres
